title: Issue when creating labelled video
body:
Windows 10, with an Anaconda Env, & DeepLabCut2.1.7 Please complete the following information about your system: OS: Windows 10 DeepLabCut Version: 2.1.7 Recieving error "ValueError: Can not convert from object to uint8." when creating labelled video.
```python deeplabcut.create_labeled_video(config_path, ['G:\DLC\FrontViewA1-Alex-2020-07-07/videos\YR3-100320-A1.avi'],s ...: ave_frames=True, videotype='.avi')

deeplabcut.create_labeled_video(config_path, ['G:\DLC\FrontViewA1-Alex-2020-07-07/videos\YR3-100320-A1.avi'],s ...: ave_frames=True, videotype='.avi') Starting % G:\DLC\FrontViewA1-Alex-2020-07-07\videos ['G:\\DLC\\FrontViewA1-Alex-2020-07-07/videos\\YR3-100320-A1.avi'] Loading G:\DLC\FrontViewA1-Alex-2020-07-07/videos\YR3-100320-A1.avi and data. The video was not analyzed with this scorer: DLC_resnet50_FrontViewA1Jul7shuffle1_300000 Other scorers were found, however: ['YR3-100320-A1DeepCut_resnet50_FrontViewA1Jul7shuffle1_300000.h5'] Creating output for: DeepCut_resnet50_FrontViewA1Jul7shuffle1_300000 instead. G:\DLC\FrontViewA1-Alex-2020-07-07\videos\temp-YR3-100320-A1 already exists! 57813 Duration of video [s]: 289.06 , recorded with 200.0 fps! Overall # of frames: 57813 with cropped frame dimensions: 720 480 Generating frames and creating video. 21%|███████████████▍ | 11892/57813 [01:39<01:27, 525.54it/s]Error: %s axis 2 is out of bounds for array of dimension 0 21%|███████████████▍ | 11927/57813 [01:39<06:21, 120.24it/s] --------------------------------------------------------------------------- ValueError Traceback (most recent call last) in ----> 1 deeplabcut.create_labeled_video(config_path, ['G:\DLC\FrontViewA1-Alex-2020-07-07/videos\YR3-100320-A1.avi'],save_frames=True, videotype='.avi') ~\.conda\envs\DLC-CPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\utils\make_labeled_video.py in create_labeled_video(config, videos, videotype, shuffle, trainingsetindex, filtered, save_frames, Frames2plot, delete, displayedbodyparts, codec, outputframerate, destfolder, draw_skeleton, trailpoints, displaycropped) 387 clip = vp(video) 388 --> 389 CreateVideoSlow(videooutname,clip,Dataframe,tmpfolder,cfg["dotsize"],cfg["colormap"],cfg["alphavalue"],cfg["pcutoff"],trailpoints,cropping,x1,x2,y1,y2,delete,DLCscorer,bodyparts,outputframerate,Frames2plot,bodyparts2connect,skeleton_color,draw_skeleton,displaycropped) 390 else: 391 if displaycropped: #then the cropped video + the labels is depicted ~\.conda\envs\DLC-CPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\utils\make_labeled_video.py in CreateVideoSlow(videooutname, clip, Dataframe, tmpfolder, dotsize, colormap, alphavalue, pcutoff, trailpoints, cropping, x1, x2, y1, y2, delete, DLCscorer, bodyparts2plot, outputframerate, Frames2plot, bodyparts2connect, skeleton_color, draw_skeleton, displaycropped) 180 imagename = tmpfolder + "/file"+str(index).zfill(nframes_digits)+".png" 181 if os.path.isfile(imagename): --> 182 image = img_as_ubyte(clip.load_frame()) #still need to read (so counter advances!) 183 else: 184 plt.axis('off') ~\.conda\envs\DLC-CPU\lib\site-packages\skimage\util\dtype.py in img_as_ubyte(image, force_copy) 501 502 """ --> 503 return convert(image, np.uint8, force_copy) 504 505 ~\.conda\envs\DLC-CPU\lib\site-packages\skimage\util\dtype.py in convert(image, dtype, force_copy, uniform) 248 if not (dtype_in in _supported_types and dtype_out in _supported_types): 249 raise ValueError("Can not convert from {} to {}." --> 250 .format(dtypeobj_in, dtypeobj_out)) 251 252 if kind_in in 'ui': ValueError: Can not convert from object to uint8. ```
